<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><a name="_Current_Announcements:"></a><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'>Current
Announcements: <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]>The Final Exam answer key has been posted below and
is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2013-fq-cs171-old-tests/2013-fq-cs-171-final-exam-key.pdf">here</a>.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]>The quiz #4 <span class=GramE>answer</span> key
has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2013-fq-cs171-old-tests/2013-fq-cs-171-quiz-4-key.pdf">here</a>.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]>A revised project Specification has been posted
to the class website with revised requirements of only (1) 9x9 <span
class=SpellE>sudoku</span>, and (2) BT and FC only; extra credit will be given
for extra effort.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]>As announced to the class mailing list, in
support of students with weak coding skills the project requirements have been
reduced to (1) 9x9 <span class=SpellE>sudoku</span>, and (2) BT and FC
only.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Extra credit bonus points
will be awarded to students who do more, and other changes have been made, as
discussed in that email message.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]>If you are one of the students who have weak
coding skills, I urge you to improve them.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>I say this only with the best intentions of helping your future
career.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The State of California
pays me to give advice that benefits students.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>It is highly unlikely that you will ever
get a memo from your boss in industry that begins, “In support of
employees with weak coding skills the project requirements have been
reduced....”</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]>The quiz #3 <span class=GramE>answer</span> key
has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2013-fq-cs171-old-tests/2013-fq-cs-171-quiz-3-key.pdf">here</a>.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]>Sigh.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>On Saturday, 16 Nov 2013, I now make the same offer as before:<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I believe that I now have fixed all of
the broken links below. Please notify me by email if you find a link that does
not seem to work properly. One Bonus Point will be awarded for each broken or
incorrect link found (or any other error in this website).</p>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

<h2><a name="_Goal:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Goal:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black'>The goal of this class is to familiarize you with the basic principles
of artificial intelligence. You will l</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>earn <span style='color:black'>some </span>basic
AI techniques, the problems for which they are applicable, and their
limitations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course content is organized roughly around what are often considered to be
three central pillars of AI: Search, Logic, and Learning. Topics covered
include basic search, heuristic search, game search, constraint satisfaction,
knowledge representation, logic and inference, probabilistic modeling, and
machine learning algorithms. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<h2><a name="_Class_Setup:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Class Setup:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course will be primarily lecture-based.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>There will be a Mid-term and a Final Exam.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>On every second Thursday, the first 20
minutes will be an in-class pop quiz, followed by lecture.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The frequent quizzes are intended to
encourage you to stay current with the course material.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>All exams and quizzes may cover all
material presented in class, including lectures and assigned textbook
reading.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Quizzes will cover mostly
material presented since the last quiz, and also may include questions that
many students missed on the previous quiz.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>The Final Exam will cover mostly material since the Mid-term Exam, and
also will include some questions intended to encourage you to remember the
earlier material.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>There
will be an AI coding project.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You
are allowed to do the project by yourself, or you may form project teams of two
students following the “<a
href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pair_programming">Pair Programming</a>”
paradigm.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please note that you are
encouraged to discuss concepts, methods, algorithms, etc.; but you are
forbidden to copy: (1) source code from any source, or (2) text from any source
unless properly cited and set off as a quote.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Except for class materials provided from
this class website, you must invent and write all of your own code by yourself
with your partner.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Except for
properly referenced material, you must write all of your project report by
yourself with your partner. Please note that your source code and project
report are subject to analysis by automated plagiarism detection programs, and
that direct copying will be treated as an act of academic dishonesty (please
see the section on “<a href="#_Academic_Honesty:">Academic Honesty</a>”
below).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Homework
will be assigned, but is not graded. The reason is that prior student course
evaluations alerted me to the existence of student cheating by way of copying
the homework answers.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I deplore
this degree of personal degradation in dishonest students, but I cannot control
it, and so I avoid the opportunity.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>I remain determined to create a fair and honest educational experience
for all students, as best I can.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

<h2><a name="_Textbook"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Textbook</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:red'>Required:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Russell & <span class=SpellE><span class=GramE>Norvig</span></span><span
class=GramE> :</span> Artificial Intelligence; A Modern Approach, 3<sup>rd</sup>
edition.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>The
course is based on, and the UCI bookstore has, the 3<sup>rd</sup> edition. The
assigned textbook reading is required, and is fair game for quizzes and
exams.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>You
place yourself at a distinct disadvantage if you do not have the textbook.</span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I expect that you have a personal copy
of the textbook, and quizzes and exams are written accordingly.</span></b><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Please
purchase or rent your own personal textbook for the quarter (and then resell it
back to the UCI Bookstore at the end if you don't want it for reference).</span>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='color:red'>Please do not
jeopardize your precious educational experience with the false economy of
trying to save a few dollars by not having a personal copy of the textbook.</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Also,
for your convenience, I have requested that a copy of the textbook be placed on
reserve in the UCI Science Library.</span><strong><span style='font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> There is a two-hour check-out limit. </span></strong>However,
please understand that with high student enrollments, it is unrealistic to
expect that these thin reserves will always be available when you need
them.  <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='color:red'>Please
purchase or rent your own personal textbook.</span></b><strong><span

deplore the high cost of textbooks.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>

EBay.com, Amazon.com, and related sites.<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Your
grade will be based on the bi-weekly </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>quizzes
(20%), a project (20%), a mid-term exam (25%), and a final exam (35%).</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Homework is assigned but ungraded.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Quizzes will be given the first 20 minutes of class on the
dates listed in the syllabus below.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Your lowest quiz score will be discarded in computing your grade.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>It is not possible to make-up missed
quizzes, but one missed quiz may be discarded as your lowest quiz score.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The mid-term exam will be given in class on Thursday,
November 7, and is closed-book, closed-notes.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>It is not possible to make-up a missed
mid-term exam.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2013-fq-cs171-old-tests/2013-fq-cs-171-final-exam-key.pdf"><span
style='color:windowtext;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'>The coding
project this term will be “Monster Sudoku Solver.” Standard Sudoku
is played on a 9x9 grid subdivided into nine 3x3 boxes. Every row, column, and
box must contain the digits 1 through 9 exactly once. Monster (or Mega) Sudoku
is similar, but the grid and boxes are bigger. 12x12 puzzles are played with
the numbers 1 to 9 and A, B and C in each row, column, and 3x4 box. 16x16
puzzles are played with 1 to 9 and the letters A to G in each row, column, and
4x4 box.</span></a></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2013-fq-cs171-old-tests/2013-fq-cs-171-final-exam-key.pdf"><span
style='color:windowtext;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'>An
Introduction is available <span style='mso-field-code:" HYPERLINK \0022\.\.\/projects\/sudoku-solver\/aiproject-monster-sudoku\.pdf\0022 "'>here</span>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>A Specification is available <span
style='mso-field-code:" HYPERLINK \0022\.\.\/projects\/sudoku-solver\/aiproject-monster-sudoku-write-up\.pdf\0022 "'>here</span>.<o:p></o:p></span></a></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><a
href="../projects/sudoku-solver/aiproject-monster-sudoku-write-up.pdf"><span
style='color:windowtext;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'>The
specification has been revised to contain an Appendix that gives pseudo-code
for converting between odometer strings and unsigned <span class=SpellE>fixnums</span>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>For your convenience in testing and
debugging, the first 44135 odometer values (“1” to
“ZZZ”) and their unsigned <span class=SpellE>fixnum</span>
equivalents (0 to 44134) are available <span style='mso-field-code:" HYPERLINK \0022\.\.\/projects\/sudoku-solver\/odometer-values\.txt\0022 "'><u><span
style='color:blue'>here</span></u></span>. Because I enjoy coding, I have coded
the conversion routines in my favorite language, Lisp (available <span
style='mso-field-code:" HYPERLINK \0022\.\.\/projects\/sudoku-solver\/odometer\.lisp\.txt\0022 "'><u><span
style='color:blue'>here</span></u></span>).</span></a></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><a
href="../projects/sudoku-solver/odometer.lisp.txt"><span style='color:windowtext;
text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'>See for example:</span></a></span></h2>

<h2><a name="_Academic_Honesty:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'><a href="http://www.aaai.org/home.html"><span
style='color:red;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'>Academic Honesty: </span><span
style='font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif";color:windowtext;
text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></a></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><a href="http://www.aaai.org/home.html"><span
style='color:windowtext;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'>Academic
dishonesty is unacceptable and will not be tolerated at the University of
California, Irvine. It is the responsibility of each student to be familiar
with UCI's current academic honesty policies. Please take the time to read the
current <span style='mso-field-code:" HYPERLINK \0022http\:\/\/www\.senate\.uci\.edu\/senateweb\/default2\.asp?active_page_id=754\0022 "'>UCI
Senate Academic Honesty Policies</span> and the <span style='mso-field-code:
" HYPERLINK \0022https\:\/\/www\.ics\.uci\.edu\/ugrad\/policies\/index\.php\0022 \\l \0022academic_honesty\0022 "'>ICS
School Policy on Academic Honesty</span>.</span></a></span></b></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><a
href="https://www.ics.uci.edu/ugrad/policies/index.php#academic_honesty"><span
style='color:windowtext;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'>The policies
in these documents will be adhered to scrupulously. Any student who engages in
cheating, forgery, dishonest conduct, plagiarism, or collusion in dishonest
activities, will receive an academic evaluation of ``F'' for the entire course,
with a letter of explanation to the student's permanent file. The <span
style='mso-field-code:" HYPERLINK \0022http\:\/\/www\.ics\.uci\.edu\/grad\/sao\/index\.php\0022 "'>ICS
Student Affairs Office</span> will be involved at every step of the process.
Dr. Lathrop seeks to create a level playing field for all students.</span></a></span></b></p>
